verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. Hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, in my complaint <S%H7879><s%>: Preserve <S%H5341><s%> my life <S%H2416><s%> from fear <S%H6343><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%>.
Hide <S%H5641><s%> me from the secret counsel <S%H5475><s%> of evil-doers <S%H7489><s%>, From the tumult <S%H7285><s%> of the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>;
Who have whet <S%H8150><s%> their tongue <S%H3956><s%> like a sword <S%H2719><s%>, And have aimed <S%H1869><s%> their arrows <S%H2671><s%>, even bitter <S%H4751><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>,
That they may shoot <S%H3384><s%> in secret <S%H4565><s%> places at the perfect <S%H8535><s%>: Suddenly <S%H6597><s%> do they shoot <S%H3384><s%> at him <S%H3372><s%>, and fear not.

They encourage <S%H2388><s%> themselves in an evil <S%H7451><s%> purpose <S%H1697><s%>; They commune <S%H5608><s%> of laying <S%H2934><s%> snares <S%H4170><s%> privily <S%H2934><s%>; They say <S%H559><s%>, Who will see them <S%H7200><s%>?

They search out <S%H2664><s%> iniquities <S%H5766><s%>; We have accomplished <S%H8552><s%>, say they <S%H2664><s%>, a diligent search <S%H2665><s%>: And the inward <S%H7130><s%> thought and the heart <S%H3820><s%> of every one <S%H376><s%> is deep <S%H6013><s%>.
But God <S%H430><s%> will shoot <S%H3384><s%> at them <S%H2671><s%>; With an arrow suddenly <S%H6597><s%> shall they be wounded <S%H4347><s%>.
So they shall be made to stumble <S%H3782><s%>, their own tongue <S%H3956><s%> being against them <S%H7200><s%>: All that see them shall wag the head <S%H5074><s%>.
And all men <S%H120><s%> shall fear <S%H3372><s%>; And they shall declare <S%H5046><s%> the work <S%H6467><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>, And shall wisely consider <S%H7919><s%> of his doing <S%H4639><s%>.

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall be glad <S%H8055><s%> in Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, and shall take refuge <S%H2620><s%> in him <S%H3477><s%>; And all the upright in heart <S%H3820><s%> shall glory <S%H1984><s%>.
